title: David Bowie - Station To Station (1976) Deluxe [3CD] [EAC-FLAC]
description:
David Bowie - Station To Station (1976) Deluxe Edition [3CD][EAC-FLAC]
            EAC rip (secure mode) | FLAC (tracks)+CUE+LOG -> 862 Mb 
                     Full Artwork @ 300 dpi (jpg) -> 95 Mb 



Deluxe re-release of David Bowie's hugely influential 1976 album, Station to Station. This 3-CD set includes the complete original album together with the much bootlegged live favourite and previously unreleased Live Nassau Coliseum '76. STATION TO STATION was the soundtrack to Bowie's nightlife. 

CD ONE

An interesting remaster. I was perfectly happy with my 1999 remaster but I appreciate the "toned-down" (less loud) sound on this one and the 70s-style stereo, which is always a treat to listen to. I wish they would do it with other albums such as Aladdin Sane, Diamond Dogs and Young Americans. You do have to turn your volume control up a bit louder though.

CD TWO

Astonishingly good live cuts. Wonderful sound, great versions of the songs played by a top notch bunch of musicians. Such a pleasure to listen to. I can't stop listening to it. Within a year and three quarters, Bowie had knocked "David Live" into a bipperty bopperty hat.

CD THREE

I agree, there is a slight discernable change in sound quality, and Life On Mars (why Bowie only sang half of it I'm not sure) and Five Years are clearly a bit crackly in the background. The rest of the CD is perfectly acceptable though and I certainly would not describe it as "bootleg quality". If indeed it is bootleg quality however, it is a very good bootleg ! I wish my other bootlegs sounded like this ! The playing of the band gets a tad more frenetic and sloppy as the gig reaches its climax, but isn't that always the way ? Early songs in the set list are always played more diligently.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
